marketNews.title: DHE SDA Revised, Government Provides Flexibility
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto on Monday (17/2) officially issued Government Regulation No. 8/2025 which mandates the deposit of 100 percent of foreign exchange from natural resource exports (DHE SDA) domestically for 1 year. This policy takes effect starting March 1, 2025. This new regulation does not apply to the oil and gas sector, where the implementation of DHE SDA placement for this sector will still refer to Government Regulation No. 36/2023 with a placement of 30% for 3 months. President Prabowo estimates that the revision of this regulation will cause foreign exchange from exports held in domestic banks to potentially increase by 80 billion US dollars by the end of 2025 or more than 100 billion US dollars in the next 12 months since its implementation. The revision of the DHE SDA placement rule itself is intended to increase the supply of state foreign exchange to ease pressure on the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar recently. Although the portion and tenor have increased, the revision of the DHE SDA rule provides room for exporters to use foreign exchange from exports placed in special accounts for several purposes, namely: Exchange to Rupiah in the same bank for business operations Payment of tax obligations, state revenues, and other obligations to the government Payment of dividends in foreign currency Payment for the procurement of goods and services that are not yet available domestically Repayment of loans for capital goods procurement in foreign currency. Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, stated that the government will ensure the DHE SDA policy does not cause disruption to companies. Several association representatives also indicated that they do not object to the new regulation. According to the Executive Director of the Indonesia Mining Association, Hendra Sinadia, the revision of this regulation provides room for exporters to maintain company cash flow. Key Takeaway: The revision of the DHE SDA placement rule has the potential to provide a positive sentiment towards banking issuers along with the addition of foreign exchange liquidity. With the flexibility that allows the use of export foreign exchange for operational and financial needs, we assess that the regulation revision does not provide too significant an influence on the sustainability of natural resource exporters' businesses.

marketNews.title: DPR Passes Minerba Law Amendment
marketNews.content: The Parliament on Tuesday (18/2) ratified the amendment to the Minerba Law, which aims to increase downstreaming and mining access for religious community organizations and MSMEs. The revision of the law allows priority access for mining concessions for companies aiming to build processing facilities, taking into account investment size, added value, and job creation. In addition, religious community organizations and MSMEs will also be allowed priority access to certain mining areas, whereas previously priority access was only granted to State-Owned Enterprises. Previously, the amendment to the Minerba Law also included universities in the list of parties allowed priority access, but universities were later removed from the list in the final draft.

marketNews.title: Xi Jinping Meets with Chinese Private Sector Leaders
marketNews.content: Chinese President, Xi Jinping, on Monday (17/2) led a meeting with leading Chinese entrepreneurs, including Alibaba founder, Jack Ma. Bloomberg reported that this meeting indicates the return of Chinese government support for the private sector to revive the country's economy, following a series of crackdowns by Xi Jinping on the internet industry and the private sector in 2020. Nevertheless, it is still unclear to what extent the Chinese government plans to change its stance towards the private sector.

marketNews.title: OPEC+ Not Considering Delaying April Oil Supply Hike
marketNews.content: Russian Deputy Prime Minister, Alexander Novak, said on Monday (17/2) that OPEC+ is not considering delaying the monthly oil supply increase scheduled to begin in April 2025. Novak's statement came after Bloomberg reported that OPEC+ was reviewing whether to delay the supply increase, despite US President Donald Trump's call to lower oil prices.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Studies B50 Biodiesel Implementation in 2026
marketNews.content: The Director General at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi, said on Tuesday (18/2) that the Ministry is studying the implementation of a biodiesel blend containing 50% CPO (B50) in 2026. Eniya also mentioned that the Ministry targets the implementation of a 3% CPO blend for jet fuel in 2026.

marketNews.title: Apple Suppliers Exploring iPhone Production in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Nikkei Asia reported that Apple is discussing with several of its suppliers the possibility of establishing an iPhone factory in Indonesia, driven by the sales ban on iPhone 16 in Indonesia since October 2024 due to the lack of in-country component level certification (TKDN). If the factory construction materializes, Indonesia will become the second country in Southeast Asia after Vietnam to have an iPhone production facility.

marketNews.title: Economists Expect BI to Hold BI Rate at 5.75%
marketNews.content: The consensus of economists compiled by Bloomberg expects Bank Indonesia to maintain the BI Rate at 5.75% in the Board of Governors Meeting tomorrow, Wednesday (19/2).

tickerNews.title: BBNI Upgrades Share Buyback Fund Allocation to IDR 1.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: BBNI: Bank Negara Indonesia announced a change in the maximum fund allocation to conduct a share buyback, from the initial 905 billion rupiah to 1.5 trillion rupiah. The schedule for the GMS to approve this corporate action will remain on March 26, 2025. The share buyback will be implemented no later than 12 months after obtaining GMS approval, with the repurchased shares later to be allocated for the employee and/or director and commissioner share ownership program.

tickerNews.title: BTPS Posts IDR 291 Billion Net Profit in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: BTPS: Bank BTPN Syariah recorded a net profit of 291 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+278% YoY, +33% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 2024 reaching 1.1 trillion rupiah (-1.8% YoY). This result was supported by income after profit sharing distribution amounting to 1.2 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (-7.9% YoY, +0.5% QoQ), so that income after profit sharing distribution for 2024 reached 4.9 trillion rupiah (-7% YoY). Furthermore, provision expense decreased to 251 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-64% YoY, -35% QoQ), causing provision expense for 2024 to decrease by -28% YoY to 1.4 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: EXCL-FREN Merger Targeted to Complete in April 2025
tickerNews.content: EXCL: The ultimate beneficiary recipient of Smartfren Telecom (FREN), Franky Widjaja, stated that the merger between XL Axiata and FREN is targeted to complete in April 2025. Franky mentioned that they are currently processing the merger with relevant authorities, including the OJK and the Ministry of Communication and Digital. FREN: (Mentioned secondarily in context of merger with EXCL)

tickerNews.title: IDNY Denies Rumors of Divesting Kideco Jaya Agung Stake
tickerNews.content: INDY: Indika Energy President Director, Arsjad Rasjid, stated that the company has no current plans to divest the coal mining asset managed by PT Kideco Jaya Agung. Bisnis reported that rumors of this divestment had circulated among market players since the beginning of 2025. Arsjad also said that INDY will calculate carefully regarding the current coal asset divestment plan. Furthermore, Arsjad confirmed that the Awak Mas gold mining project - which is estimated to have a production capacity of 100,000 troy ounces per year - will begin production in 2026.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Controller Purchased ~14.4 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: AKRA: The controller and President Commissioner of AKR Corporindo, Soegiarto Adikoesoemo, purchased approximately 14.4 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,068 rupiah per share on February 12-14, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 15.4 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Soegiarto Adikoesoemo's direct ownership in AKRA increased from 0.574% to 0.646%.

tickerNews.title: RAAM Controller Purchased ~8.8 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: RAAM: The controller and President Commissioner of Tripar Multivision Plus, Ram Jethmal Punjabi, purchased approximately 8.8 million RAAM shares at an average price of 329 rupiah per share on February 11-14, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.9 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Ram Jethmal Punjabi's direct ownership in RAAM increased from 70.34% to 70.47%.

tickerNews.title: BDMN Posts IDR 848 Billion Net Profit in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: BDMN: Bank Danamon Indonesia recorded a net profit of 848 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-10% YoY, -3% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 2024 reaching 3.2 trillion rupiah (-9% YoY). On the top-line, Net Interest Income (NII) grew to 3.9 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+0.1% YoY, +2% QoQ), so that NII during 2024 grew +2% YoY to 15.6 trillion rupiah. Meanwhile, provision expense rose to 1 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+2% YoY, +7% QoQ), pushing provision expense during 2024 to grow +19% YoY to 4.4 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: DCII Exploring Stock Split and Focusing on Surabaya Data Center Development
tickerNews.content: DCII: DCI Indonesia President Director, Otto Toto Sugiri, stated that the company is exploring plans to conduct a stock split, although he did not provide further details. Toto also mentioned that DCII will focus on completing the construction of a 72 million US dollar data center in Surabaya, East Java. The 9 MW capacity data center is targeted for completion in early 2026. Furthermore, besides the construction of the data center in Surabaya, Toto stated that DCII is completing the construction of a 36 MW capacity data center in Cibitung.

tickerNews.title: HUMI Acquires Oil Tanker for Fuel Distribution Business Expansion
tickerNews.content: HUMI: Humpuss Maritim Internasional, through its subsidiary, PT Hutama Trans Kencana, purchased 1 unit of oil tanker from PT Patria Nusasegara for 7.05 million US dollars. This transaction is aimed at the business development of fuel distribution.

tickerNews.title: IDX Halts Trading of WIKA Stock Following Default on Debt Payments
tickerNews.content: IDX halted the trading of Wijaya Karya (WIKA) stock, following an announcement from WIKA that the company had postponed the principal payment of its sukuk and bonds due on February 18, 2025. IDX stated that WIKA's announcement indicated problems with the company's business continuity. Previously, WIKA had proposed full settlement and a two-year extension for the remaining principal of the related bonds and mudharabah sukuk, but the Creditors' Meeting and the General Shareholders' Meeting could not make a decision on the proposal.
